reviews.review_msg: The best professor so far. Possibly better then any professor in the future.
very interesting lectures
INTRIGUING
an inspirational thinker
There are easier professors but what's the point in going to school if you don't learn anything..
automagically
worthwhile
meticlous
down to earth
The course itself is interesting . But the attitude of this instructor is unacceptable . Never take courses with this woman , ever, again !!!!!

I enjoyed the lectures and the reading material, this course was very sci-fi heavy (which I was happy about!) I don't understand all the negative comments, I thought this class was fine. I didn't love my TA or tutorial (a lot of students there who clearly didn't care to be there and put little to no effort in.) The class itself was enjoyable!
terrible!

Absolutely fantastic, very interesting, presents an extremely nuanced look at all the texts read. If I had one complaint it would be the first "in-class" paper, which she expected us to be prepared for without telling us the questions we were preparing for. However, she took feedback and the remaining papers were much better/smoother.

Alison's lectures are truly inspiring and vigorous. The ideas she presents seep into your head and have the capacity to impact you on a much deeper level. Definitely a life-changing experience, look at what you gain beyond just the grades. Not saying it's a hard course, but expect to really explore your ideas and presenting them in your essays :)

Although the course material was quite dry a lot of the time, she did a good job trying to keep us engaged. There were only two graded assignments and the final exam. The rest of our grade was determined by our participation in tutorials. Overall the assignments weren't too difficult. She was very approachable if any clarification was needed.
English with her felt pointless. I did learn a few things but overall I felt like I was wasting my time. Good prof, but the topics were not engaging

Absolute joke of a class. She is stuck in the past. She is so fixed on us knowing how to cite everything by memory. She does not realise that internet exists now. Her finals expectation is insane for a 100 level class. Extremely strict just to fit her agenda. I am sure a lot of year 1 students are scarred by her. DW, its just her.
Calls you out infront of the class if you're not sitting up straight, even though you're paying attention to her lecture.
Extremely disorganized and lectures seemed pointless. She needs to use a mic and better visual aids. Not very engaging.

Professor Everton is very kind and smart! He genuinely wants all of his students to succeed. You can go to him with any questions and he will be more than willing to answer them. People complain a lot about him being a harsh marker, but I found his marking to be perfectly fair. The Canvas page was also very organized which was helpful.

Professor Everton's class was awesome. Had to take it online because of COVID, but he has the online and canvas environment under control, and easy to use. My TA was fantastic as well. Highly recommend! But beware, the marking is tough.

Lectures are great and interesting. Although it was online, he put in effort to make it a little spooky and added his own twists. There are mandatory tutorials which was pretty easy just lots of discussing. Papers were your core marks and they were marked very hard but I'm pretty bad at english papers in general. Get help with it if you need.

Mike is very passionate about what he teaches, keeps his lectures engaging, but doesn't go easy on anyone. He and the TAs are there to help you - even if you're a strong English student, PLEASE talk to them about your assignments. Overall, I learned a lot and really enjoyed being in this class. (Great intro to horror literature/concepts!)

Dr. Everton never had a boring lecture, and always gave you something to really think about. The online course had two big papers, and the final was basically a collection of several smaller essays, so be prepared to write a lot. Both Everton and the TAs are tough markers, but you will learn a lot from them.

You can tell Dr. Everton is a good prof if you are into English. Do not take him if you are not strong in the subject or writing. There are two papers that are graded very hard but he does not focus on how to improve your writing so it is kinda unfair. You have to be good at analyzing stories to succeed in this course.

He is very passionate about this course (horror literature) which made lectures more intriguing. He also gave a lot of advice for writing papers and was really helpful when you needed questions answered. If you needed lessons on grammar, he was willing to have a one-on-one chat with you about it. Overall, I would take a course of his again.

His lecture is engaging, hilarious and energetic. He makes creative and colorful slides and speaks at a normal pace so that we can catch up with him. not so tough for 100 level class, there's no essay on final exam. However, grading is hard for essays and criteria are clear.

Dr. Everton is by far the best professor I have had here at SFU. His lectures always introduced interesting concepts that left you never checking the clock--unless it was in hopes the class would have more time left! The assigned readings were good, too and they were not excessive. Only thing is the grading is tough, but the class is worth it!
Great lectures and very interesting, however he is an extremely hard marker. Expect 2-4 letter grades lower than your usual on papers.

I absolutely love Dr. Everton! Such an amazing teacher, keeps lectures fun and engaging, and is very interested in what he is discussing. Finals are highly based on whether you show up to class and read all the material, but he is fair. Super funny guy, who made me love English more than I already did, would definitely take a course with him again!

Jon  is an awesome prof. His exams  while not easy, are very passable as long as you attend lecture and focus on textual evidence of the close readings he gives. I also had an amazing TA (shoutout Belle), which while unfortunate your TA definitely dictates how well/ how much you like the class. Jon is so great that I'm taking another of his classes

Jon was one of the coolest profs I've taken, especially considering it was my first English course at SFU. The books were amazing, TAs were amazing, and Jon was always willing to converse. I'm taking another course of his this semester, and I know I won't regret it. Take one of his courses if you get the chance!

If I could take this course again, I absolutely would. Jon is an amazing prof and especially for someone just starting off at SFU, this course was so much fun. He also encourages discussion and participation which is really helpful when understanding various texts. You won't regret taking this course!

Jon is a pretty decent prof. He kept the midterm and final to content he mentioned in lecture so attending them and taking notes while you're there is important. The paper was also not that difficult. My hand hurt after all the writing for the final but at least he handed out timbits every hour of it lol.

It was a horrible final exam. Level of difficulty is ridiculously high for 1st year course. Easy miderm. He does not post anything.. i mean anything on canvas. Not even the assignment rubric. Good luck.

Jon is an amazing prof, he cares about his students getting enough information for exams. Satanic verses was a hard read, even for those who read a lot. The thing i hate is that you can end up with a terrible TA. My TA was incredibly rude to people in the class (not Jon's fault but just a heads up). Don't take if you hate participating.

Professor Smith is engaging. The course is heavily based on the lectures so make sure you pay attention to the specific passages that he mentions. as for tutorials, I personally think that everything is fairly marked. the readings are heavy and boring, however if you pay attention in the lectures, they aren't too important. tests are easy.

Jon is a guy who well-respects his students, and you can clearly tell he just wants whats best for you. However, he sometimes gets distracted by random topics that he may think are relevant to his lecture. He's got some good humour if you're into dry humour, and he makes class entertaining. But lectures are mandatory because the exams are lec based
he's so boringggg!!! does not post anything on canvas so if you miss a class good luck for the essays. Midterms easy but marks are ridiculously hard for a first-year course. He acts very entitled

I really enjoy his lecture most of the time, but he's definitely extremely pretentious. Thinks very highly of himself, and doesn't hesitate to impose his superiority over his first year classes. 
Might be better for this guy to stick to teaching higher level classes, because those students maybe he would view as real, intelligent, people.

Hard to get higher than an A- in my opinion. I'm no award-winning writer, but I took another English course and found the grading to be easier. I have to give Jon credit where it's due though because I did learn a hell of a lot in his class!

Jon is engaging during lectures and tries to add humour to it. He does his best answering questions that students have. He posts additional material on canvas but no review material. Make sure to go to every class because theres a good chance a passage mentioned will be on the exam. Some topics were too difficult for a first year course.
Best English prof I've had! He is super helpful and engaging. I really hope to have him again! TAKE HIS COURSE FOR SURE :)

Studied 7 books for this class, & he made the lectures incredible! Such an interesting man; makes everything seem so interesting. His choice of TA's was amazing; mine gave the best feedback I've ever received & it was really clear she wanted us to do well. Grading criteria is made very clear & you are taken step-by-step through the writing process.
